src:
Iwan Bule Ketua PSSI, Cucu Sumantri dan Iwan Budianto Jadi Wakil
02 Nov 2019, 08:46 by Irsyan Hasyim (Kontributor), Nurdin Saleh
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Kongres Luar Biasa atau KLB PSSI telah menetapkan Mochamad Iriawan alias Iwan Bule sebagai Ketua Umum Periode 2019-2023. Pada agenda selanjutnya dilakukan pemilihan Wakil Ketua Umum. Hasilnya Cucu Sumantri dan Iwan Budianto menjadi pendamping Mantan Kapolda Metro Jaya ini untuk empat tahun ke depan.
Pada sesi pemilihan wakil ketua, 85 voters memilih 15 calon wakil ketua umum. Hasilnya Cucu Sumantri meraih 81 suara dan Iwan Budianto sebanyak 74 suara. Calon lainnya yang mendapatkan suara yakni Djamal Azis 1 suara, Esti Puji Lestari 2 suara, Hasnuryadi sulaiman 2 suara, Hinca pandjaitan 2 suara, dan Yesayas oktavianus 2. Dua suara dinyatakan tidak sah.
Kongres ini akan diikuti 86 voter dari berbagai anggota PSSI. 86 voter PSSI terdiri dari 34 Asosiasi Provinsi (Asprov), 18 klub Liga 1, 16 klub Liga 2, 16 klub Liga 3, 1 Asosiasi Futsal (FFI) dan 1 Asosiasi Sepak Bola Wanita.
Pada KLB ini perwakilan FIFA dan AFC juga turut hadir. Sebelumnya, dalam pemilihan Ketua Umum, Iwan Bule menang dengan meraih 82 suara dari 86 suara. Ia mengatakan keberhasilannya meraih suara mayoritas iru merupakan kemenangan bersama.
"Ini bukan kemenangan saya, ini kemenengan insan sepak bola Indonesia yang bertekad memajukan sepak bola yang kita cintai," kata dia di Hotel Shangri-La, Jakarta, Sabtu, 2 November 2019.
Mantan Kepala Kepolisian Daerah Metro Jaya ini mengaku sudah bertemu dengan Presiden Federasi Sepak Bola Dunia (FIFA) Gianni Infantino. Pertemuan itu berlangsung di Bangkok dengan agenda membahas pelaksanaan Piala Dunia U-20 tahun 2021. "Ini jadi pekerjaan besar bagi kita semuanya," kata dia.
Iwan Bule secara resmi menjadi Ketua Umum PSSI periode 2019-2023. Dia mengalahkan dua kandidat lainnya, yakni Rahim Soekasah dan Arif Putra Wicaksono.
IRSYAN HASYIM
text:
Iwan Bule Chairperson of PSSI, Cucu Sumantri and Iwan Budianto Become Representatives
02 Nov 2019, 08:46 by Irsyan Hasyim (Contributor), Nurdin Saleh
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Extraordinary Congress or PSB KLB has set Mochamad Iriawan alias Iwan Bule as Chair of the 2019-2023 Period. The next agenda was to elect the Deputy Chairperson. As a result, Cucu Sumantri and Iwan Budianto became the companion of the former Metro Jaya Police Chief for the next four years.
In the vice chair election session, 85 voters chose 15 candidates for deputy chairman. The result was Cucu Sumantri won 81 votes and Iwan Budianto as many as 74 votes. Other candidates who won were Djamal Azis 1 vote, Esti Puji Lestari 2 votes, Hasnuryadi sulaiman 2 votes, Hinca pandjaitan 2 votes, and Yesayas octavian 2. 2. Two votes were declared invalid.
This congress will be followed by 86 voters from various PSSI members. 86 PSSI voters consisted of 34 Provincial Associations (Asprov), 18 League 1 clubs, 16 League 2 clubs, 16 League 3 clubs, 1 Futsal Association (FFI) and 1 Women's Football Association.
At this outbreak, FIFA and AFC representatives were also present. Previously, in the election of the Chairperson, Iwan Bule won by winning 82 votes out of 86 votes. He said his success in winning the majority vote was a joint victory.
"This is not my victory, this is the victory of Indonesian soccer people who are determined to advance the football that we love," he said at the Shangri-La Hotel, Jakarta, Saturday, November 2, 2019.
The former Metro Jaya Regional Police Chief admitted that he had met with the President of the World Football Federation (FIFA) Gianni Infantino. The meeting took place in Bangkok with an agenda to discuss the implementation of the U-20 World Cup in 2021. "This is a big job for all of us," he said.
Iwan Bule officially became the General Chair of PSSI 2019-2023. He defeated two other candidates, namely Rahim Soekasah and Arif Putra Wicaksono.
IRSYAN HASYIM
